original_title: Top corporates onboard to power CA Sri Lanka’s 45th National Conference
original_body_lines: Some of Sri Lanka’s well-known corporates, including leading conglomerates, have come on board to sponsor the 45th National Conference of Chartered Accountants of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Sri Lanka (CA Sri Lanka), which will be ceremoniously inaugurated today (14) at the Monarch Imperial, Sri Jayawardenepura, Kotte.
Indian High Commissioner Santosh Jha is the Chief Guest and will deliver the keynote speech at the inauguration ceremony.

The three-day event which will conclude on 16 October, will deliberate and delve on the timely and relevant theme “Marching Beyond Margins”, and is aimed at helping Sri Lanka embrace future-forward transformation on its journey to rebuild the country and its economy.
Hayleys PLC, John Keells Group and Sanasa Life will power this year’s national conference as platinum sponsors.

The exclusive automobile partner is Abans Auto Ltd., exclusive real estate partner is Capitol Towers Ltd., exclusive banking partner is Nations Trust Bank, and the exclusive healthcare partner is Nawaloka Hospitals PLC.

Another 18 leading companies, representing diverse sectors, have also joined hands with the conference as Gold sponsors. The Gold sponsors are AIA Insurance Lanka Ltd., Capital Alliance, Ceylinco Life Insurance Ltd., Ceyline Holdings Ltd., DAMRO, DIMO, Enterprise Analytics Ltd., Giftworks by Rainco Ltd, Insureme, LankaPay Ltd., LB Finance PLC, Merchant Bank of Sri Lanka Finance PLC, People’s Leasing & Finance PLC, SITREK Group, Softlogic Life Insurance PLC, South Asia Gateway Terminals Ltd., Sunshine Holdings PLC and Tokyo Cement.
The Bronze sponsors are C. W. Mackie PLC, Expolanka Holdings PLC, Lanka IOC and North Sails.
The print media partners are Daily FT, Daily Mirror, and Sunday Times.

Renowned as Sri Lanka’s largest business summit, the conference will attract over 2,000 delegates, including some of the country’s most powerful minds, ranging from business leaders, c-suite executives, and entrepreneurs.
